intro: Navarretia plieantha, commonly known as the pleated navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pleated leaves and small, white flowers. This species typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates. Navarretia plieantha is known for its short blooming period, usually in spring, and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
